course_title: Topics in German Studies: Yiddish for Speakers of German
class_notes:
(Same as JS 372 1)


This one-credit course will offer exposure to spoken Yiddish from both classical and modern sources while introducing students to the Yiddish alphabet. With a focus on film and theater, we will engage with materials in various dialects, including Hasidic and standard Yiddish. Students will also learn about the thousand-year history of Yiddish, and how this fusion of Middle High German with Semitic, Slavic, and Romantic elements became, for a time, the most widely spoken Jewish language in the world.
course_description: Taught in German. An interdisciplinary course intended to provide in-depth study of formative elements, influences, and movements in German-speaking culture(s). May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
